article.title: XSL in Xopus
article.introduction: Xopus supports a lot of XSL features. There a only a very few things to keep in mind when using an XSL for Xopus, but there is a boatload of tricks you can use to make the XSL work better in Xopus.

section.title: Template Output
section.paragraph: Every element from the XML that you wish to edit, needs to be represented in the output of the XSL. That means that templates that match on an element should output at least something, even if the element itself is empty. The following XSL could cause problems:

section.title: Writing XSL for Xopus
section.introduction: XSL can be used to hide and show different parts of an XML document. You can think of meta-data and the actual content. It can be used to show more than just WYSUIWYG output, like buttons to add, remove or move elements or to provide more functionality to edit an element.

The node object is an Xopus DOM Object, such as an XopusElement.
